definition: a poor example, excuse, overlook, or make allowances for
details:
noun
- a poor example
= synonyms: apology
- a note explaining an absence
= example: a note explaining an absence
- a defense of some offensive behavior or some failure to keep a promise
= example: a defense of some offensive behavior or some failure to keep a promise
= synonyms: exculpation
verb
- excuse, overlook, or make allowances for
= synonyms: condone
- serve as a reason or cause or justification of
= example: serve as a reason or cause or justification of
= synonyms: explain
- grant exemption or release to
= example: grant exemption or release to
= synonyms: exempt
- ask for permission to be released from an engagement
= synonyms: beg off
- defend, explain, clear away, or make excuses for by reasoning
= synonyms: rationalise, rationalize, justify, apologise, apologize
- accept an excuse for
= example: accept an excuse for
= synonyms: pardon
